citeinfo.title: Communties at risk at the census block group level due to a projected sea level rise of 1 meter by 2100 in Corpus Christi Bay, Texas.

serinfo.sername: TNC Coastal Conservation and Resiliency Analyses

pubinfo.pubplace: 205 N. Carizzo Street, Corpus Christi, TX, 78401, US

citeinfo.title: Informing conservation and resiliency planning using sea-level rise and storm-surge scenario impact estimates in Corpus Christi Bay

serinfo.sername: TNC Coastal Conservation and Resiliency Analyses

descript.abstract: This analysis communities at risk at the census block level in the Corpus Christi Bay region of Texas that are potentially exposed to 1 meter of SLR in the year 2100.
descript.purpose: This file was created for The Nature Conservancy's Sea Level Rise Project for the northern Gulf of Mexico with funding from the Coastal Bend Bays and Estuary Program (CBBEP). This dataset shows communities at risk for each block group in Corpus Christi Bay, Texas that are potentially exposed to 1 meter of SLR in the year 2100. The map represents the risk communities face due to sea level rise and their social vulnerability. Risk is defined as the outcome of the interaction between the hazard impact, the level of exposure of the elements at risk to the hazard, and the vulnerability of the elements at risk (Shepard et al. 2011). This analysis shows at risk communities in Corpus Christi Bay, Texas due to a 1 m SLR scenario by 2100. The input datasets include the SoVI dataset and the community exposure analysis that estimates the percentage of each block group exposed to various inundation scenarios. High risk communities in this analysis are those that are classified as having higher social vulnerability and higher exposure to SLR. Low risk communities are those that have lower social vulnerability and lower exposure to SLR. Finally, the Community Risk index was calculated by classifying the exposure index with the SoVI into a 1-5 (low to high) ranking system where blocks groups that experienced high exposure and high social vulnerability (e.g. 5), were considered highest risk, while block groups with medium exposure and medium social vulnerability were considered medium risk (e.g. 3), and so forth.

procstep.procdesc: TNC Conservation and Resiliency analyses were created from SLAMM and ADCIRC modeling outputs for Corpus Christi Bay, Texas (see reports at www.SLRportal.org)

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier for each block group

attrdomv.udom: Aggregate SoVI Score - low numbers represent low social vulnerability with increasing values representing higher vulnerability
SoVI vulnerability ranking (SOVI_VUL) descriptions (low, medium, high)
Area in sq. meters defining the features.
Area (sq. meters) of inundation by sea level rise within the block group features.
Percent of block group area (0-100) exposed to sea level rise inundation

attr.attrdef: Sea level rise exposure 2100 ranking (0 TO 3)

attrdomv.udom: Exposure ranking descriptions based on SLR_EXP_1 (none, low, medium and high)

attr.attrdef: Sea level rise Risk by block group ranking
